TextBody:
Hello Daniel,

My name is Ramon with Netwrix Technical Support and I have been assigned to this case. To know the licensing status for the Endpoint Protector, please go to System Configuration -> System Licensing. Licensed Endpoints are the Windows and Mac computers that have the EPP agent installed on them. The endpoint licenses are assigned on a first-in-first served basis. 



The first 100 computers to connect to the EPP appliance using the EPP agent will be able to communicate with the EPP client. While any device over  the first 100 will not be able to connect to the EPP Appliance. You can install the EPP client to more machines after 100, yet the policies will not be sent therefore no restrictions will be enforced on these computers. To manage licenses, you can select View Licenses on the same page and select which device you may want to release the license from, by selecting the License and which computer it is assigned to and selecting the release license button under actions. Please see below. 



Or you can use the Automatic Release Licenses functionality, where the licenses will be released automatically for endpoints that have not been seen online in a specific number of days (15 days, 30 days, 90 days, or a custom value).


Please let me know if this answers your questions or if you have further questions. 

Thank you. 

Best Regards, 
Ramon Torres | Technical Support Engineer

ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0ONOrt:ref
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #442968 - ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000ONOrt:ref - Netwrix DLP Endpoint Protector Licenses    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0ONOrt:ref ]

TextBody:
Hello Daniel,

To add to the last email I sent, 
When you install the EPP agent on a machine, right after the installation is complete, the agent will try to communicate with the server, based on the IP you provided at the install. If the communication is successful, the agent will be assigned a license by the server and it will start receiving settings and policies.

Once all the licenses are assigned, if you install the agent on more machines, the agents will communicate with the server, but will not be assigned any license, since there will be no free licenses left. There are no extra charges, the only thing that happens is that those agents will not be able to enforce any policies/restrictions. We can not check from here the repartition of the licenses, how many are free, etc. You would need to check that with the person that is super admin of the EPP solution, that have access to the System Licensing

Also, you will need to be added as a System Administrator in order to view the System Licensing tab. A system administrator can go to System Configuration ->System Administrators and create a system administrator account for you, so you can view the System Licensing tab.



Please let me know if you have further questions. 

Thank you.

Best Regards, 
Ramon Torres | Technical Support Engineer
